When ever I'm in Chicago I always make sure I stop and get popcorn so when I seen Las Vegas had a Garretts it was on my "must visit" list for this trip. I am never disappointed with their caramel corn. It is so fresh and buttery, well worth a special treat.

A must stop every time I visit or fly through Chicago, can't wait to get some while in Vegas. I always have to bring back lots extra for family and friends.

Delicious popcorn with a wide variety of flavors. The portion size is enough for 2 people and I loved the cheese one.

I really enjoyed this restaurant. The menu was top quality and the food was excellent. There is also a great selection of Craft Ale and the service we had was superb off a young man who was very knowledgeable on the craft Ale scene,and who was great fun and very polite.

Awesome food! Awesome cocktails! Worth the trip off the strip. Recommend the Pork Belly Ramen and the Hah Soan's Burro to drink.

Ate hear twice during a 3 day stay. Awesome turkey pastrami and house potato chips. Get the hard rock "backstage pass gaming card-free" for a free pretzel bites and cheese, which are divine. My daughter is vegan, and she had hummus and pitas and a few sides. The brussel sprouts were crazy good. Good happy hour too.

Go for happy hour! Cheap beers and tasty snacks.
One minor thing to be aware of though, if you're staying at the Hard Rock you may not be able to use a f&b credit for this place.

Lobster ME has several varieties of VERY tasty lobster rolls. If you are staying in the Elara or Planet Hollywood or visit the Miracle Mile, this is a great place to grab lunch or dinner. We chose to eat there twice in our 4 days in Vegas!

Wow - I am a complete Maine lobster snob and the lobster roll I had here was fantastic! So were the fries! Servers were really great and helpful as I tried to choose one. Really great - don't miss it!

Very good Lobster roll sandwich. bisque was just ok. Nice to get lobster easily. Would recommend. Good value.

Went after the JLo concert at the Planet Hollywood and it was delish! Had the Beltway and the Original Lobster Rolls. They were both fantastic and fresh. The bread is so buttery and melt in your mouth. The homemade chips are crunchy and yummy! Would definitely go again and try the other menu items. Service was fast and friendly.

I had the lobster melt sandwich which was delicious and rich but a bit expensive ($12). Would go there again.

I ran across this place walking around the Planet Hollywood shops and I ended up going here three days in a row. The Connecticut roll is to die for.

food was ok. bit pricey for what you get. its fast food lobster and you're paying the price of a full course meal for what looks like half a sandwich and fries with lobster and cheese thrown on them.

Servers and food deliver guys were so nice!!Great time had by all good Venue but should include shots when they score would be fun. 🏈👍🏻🍸

Great casual bar/eatery serving American food in a relaxed atmosphere - Bucking Bull can be ridden and many TVs showing sport

This is a very cool place. I would recommend sitting outside on the patio. Great atmosphere, cool music. The waitress was super busy and running her butt off but was still able to provide great service. Kudos to her. The food was very good. Large portions. Good experience.

Located in Planet Hollywood
We ate breakfast and the serving is large and good taste

Good servers.

Great bar on the Strip! Went during the PBR and saw many celebrities from the bull riding world at the after party. Fun and loud and a good time was had by all! Great band and good food too!

I gave only a 3 star as I found it over priced. The service was good and all the food that we ordered was great. Breakfast was really good, we ate there twice for breakfast. Lunch was good as well. Too bad it wasn't open for supper/dinner.

You get what you pay for. Even though this is a small café and it's a little pricey, the food is great and you get a lot of it. Very good, we ate here multiple times during a 5 day visit.

Came here for breakfast while staying at the hotel. Service was very slow and food was just average. The eggs benedict was below average but the orange juice was fresh squeezed and good. Would go elsewhere.

I've stayed at the Luxor a few times, and usually have breakfast here a few times. As with most restaurants in Vegas, it's a little pricey (plan on $20 pp) for breakfast. But the food is good and they don't skimp on the servings. Well worth it before heading out for the day!

Although it is very robotic feeling at times, the service was very good and the food was even better.

Had the eggs benedict here. It was nice enough for the price, though the Hollandaise was a bit flat. Staff were very friendly and helpful though.

Breakfast is your best bet. Great food, large portions. Yum!! Great service. Friendly staff. A side of bacon, whether with a meal or alacarte, is about 6-8 good size strips. They ask you (not many restaurants do) if you want if crispy or not. We eat here every trip to the Luxor.

The food was decent, what you would expect of someplace called a cafe. But it was really expensive. My breakfast of 3 blueberry pancakes and a glass of water was $23 before tip.

Friendly hostesses and good service made this a good place to start our day. Plenty of breakfast items on the menu to satisfy your hunger. Server was there with coffee when it was time never had to look around for them.

While dining at the Pyramid Cafe we experienced great service and enjoyed some delicious food. We had coffee and mimosas to drink, and both were decent. My friend enjoyed an omelet and I had an English muffin and fruit. I would recommend eating here while at the Luxor.

Went here off Fremont Street, really nice host, crappy waiter W/ crappy service, ordered food finally, and while eating found a black curly hair in hash browns. After being completely disgusted, Manager Francine (who was very nice and kind!) took the entrees off our bill. Really hope no one else has an experience like this :/

The service at this Denny's was exceptional as well as the food. Prices were a little high for a Denny's would be my only complaint. This Denny's has a full bar although I did not drink at the time. Outside seating along Fremont Street.

Bad food, slow service. Coffee OK.
Went with two omni mates, the pictures in the menu were a long way from what was served. I was so unimpressed wirh the choices I didnt order. Not happy Jan.

Biscuits and Gravy were Excellent. They also have Irish Coffee was Delicious and Strong. Would definitely come back and bring family and friends.

We ate there for a late breakfast while staying on Fremont. The food was good, the service fast and friendly.

The Denny's is handy for us staying at the timeshare. Food is good and quick service always. Generally you can get a discount coupon if your into extra savings as well.

Great variety of food and beverages at very reasonable prices. Super clean restaurant and restrooms. Not as crowded as the Denny's strip outlets.

Loads of food, good quality and great atmosphere. Group of us enjoyed our evening here for an average of $75 a couple. Good drink mixes.

We stopped off to grab a beer and rest our feet, ended up getting a bucket of beer and enjoying the world go by. The food looked great and the prices were good.

We enjoyed four meals here while staying at Tahiti Village for a week. Children were welcome and both children and adults had many choices on the menu. We never had to wait for a table, service was prompt and the food was good. The restaurant was very clean.

Denny's restaurant located next to Tahiti Village is open 24 hours. No matter what time I arrived there was always a crowd. Breakfast, lunch and dinner, there is a variety of menu choices. The food is good and service is fast and professional..

Two eggs, hash browns, crispy bacon, and 5 small pancakes ($8.99). Everything was cooked perfectly. Crispy bacon and hash browns as requested. The pancakes were especially tasty.
Bottom line I would return.

Across street from hotel. Menu American style. Clean, neat, home-style menu (lots of gravy, corn bread, dessserts as well as solid entrees). Wonderful staff. By far the best breakfast with lots of choices at a fair price. Everyone in our party agreed it was worth the trip through crazy vegas traffic to visit. The crepes, French toast and omelets were to die for. This will be a regular stop every time we're in town.

This Blueberry Hill diner was busy, attentive and plentiful. In style, service was immediate and attentive. Our 'eggs benedict Florentine' were well-cooked, tasty and plentiful.

Affordable, quick and delicious breakfast in a diner setting off the strip. I had the waffle with bacon and it was hot and prepared fresh. Everyone in our party enjoyed their meal and our waitress was good.

We enjoyed a lovely prix fixe menu with a cheese plate and lovely wines added to the meal. Service and food were perfection, will dine there again.

Excellent steaks, and seafood as stated in the name. Service is well done without being overbearing. The wine list will have a least one of your favorites. Good range of choices though the steaks are a perfect choice.

We came to Luxor to see Blue Man and wanted to have dinner first. Not a huge selection of restaurants, but Tenders looked appealing and we weren't disappointed. We had a great waiter and the food was excellent. Quite a few choices on the menu, too.

Tenders is the steak house for the Luxor. The atmosphere is modern, quiet enough to carry on a conversation and relaxing. Our server was wonderful. Our meals were delicious. We really enjoy visiting Tenders when we visit Las Vegas!

My husband and I stayed at Luxor after a couple of days at Spring Mountain Performance Driving Experience and were very exhausted but wanted a good meal. It was cold so we opted to eat in the hotel. I dropped by this restaurant during sunday in the strip. The seafood noodle soup is $16 that is big enough for two. It was freshly made with vegetables and seafood. The sushi rolls are half priced and made in front of the sushi bar. I am told that locals can get half price sushi roll any time.

I have eaten here many times and it is always good. They serve a good helping on every plate and have a wide variety of dishes to eat plus sushi if you like that also.

The most authentic Chinese food I could find in Vegas. The lunch specials are very reasonably priced. Even paying at full prices, they are still cheaper than neighboring restaurants in other casinos. The food is much better than other restaurants in Vegas. The traditional pot sticker is cooked the Chinese way. Definitely recommend a visit to this restaurant.

We tried the after 11pm special: New York steak, and ox tail soup. I like the salad bar as well - better than many places. They are great! Long waiting line during the Christmas weekend. Will definitely go back and try them again.

We had a second Reuben here because the first was so good! Also ordered chicken wings in medium that weren't at all hot. Service was great. We will be back for Reuben's here.
